title: Amadou Samb
text:
Amadou Samb (born 22 April 1988) is a Senegalese <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="G%C5%BCira%20United%20F.C.">Gżira United</a> in the <a href="Maltese%20Premier%20League">Maltese Premier League</a>.
Club career.
Samb was signed by professional club <a href="A.C.%20Monza%20Brianza%201912">Monza</a> in October 2008, after the court of <a href="Treviglio">Treviglio</a> upheld the appeal from Monza for the decision of <a href="Italian%20Football%20Federation">Italian Football Federation</a> (FIGC). FIGC restricted Italian clubs from signing non-EU player, in although it also has some allowance, one of them is, a non-EU senior players who purely a youth product of Italian clubs can also be registered. Before formally signed by Monza, he also played for amateur side <a href="U.S.%20Forza%20e%20Costanza">Forza e Costanza</a>, which was in <a href="Promozione">Promozione</a> (7th highest level of the pyramid). He also played for Monza in friendly before the bureaucratic clearance.
Samb played 45 games in <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Prima%20Divisione">Lega Pro Prima Divisione</a> (3rd highest level of the pyramid), for Monza in the first two seasons. He also won <a href="Campionato%20Nazionale%20Dante%20Berretti">Berretti youth league</a> as overage player. He missed few months in 2010–11 season due to injury, just played 8 times for Monza (2 in <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Coppa%20Italia">cup</a>).
On 29 January 2011 signed by <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> club <a href="A.C.%20ChievoVerona">Chievo</a>. He wore no.9 shirt. After the end of the season, he signed the loan contract for <a href="U.S.%20Cremonese">U.S. Cremonese</a>, team of Lega Pro Prima Divisione. Before he left the club, he picked no.14 shirt for <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Serie%20A">2011–12 Serie A</a>.
In the 2012–13 season he signed the loan contract for <a href="A.C.%20Lumezzane">Lumezzane</a>. On 30 June 2013 Samb was released by Chievo in order to make the team have a non-EU registration quota from abroad.
In January 2014 he was signed by cross-town rival <a href="Hellas%20Verona%20F.C.">Hellas Verona</a>, who were also in <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a>, but was immediately sent out to Albanian club <a href="KF%20Teuta%20Durr%C3%ABs">KF Teuta Durrës</a> for the remainder of the 2013–14 season on loan. He scored on his debut on 2 February against <a href="KS%20Lushnja">KS Lushnja</a> in a 6–2 victory.
On 30 August 2014 he joined <a href="Floriana%20F.C.">Floriana</a>.
